exam.question: The international situation has been growing ______ difficult for the last few years.

answer.explain: increasingly： 日益， 愈加。句意： 在过去几年里国际形势日趋严峻。presumably： 大概， 推测起来； dominantly： 占优势地， 支配地。

sentences.sContent: It invariably rains when I go there.
The security guards were invariably ex-servicemen.
sentences.sCn: 保安人员毫无例外地都是退伍军人。

sentences.sContent: ...the essay invariably returns to the favorite topic: what is its impact on you...

remMethod.val: in(不， 无) ＋ vari(看作vary， 变化) ＋ ably → 不变地

words.tran: [数] 不变量；[计] 不变式

trans.tranCn: 不变地， 始终如一地， 总是
trans.tranOther: if something invariably happens or is invariably true, it always happens or is true
